title: Add permission approval UI for image analysis
description:
**As a** Consoul user
**I want** to approve image uploads before they're sent to the LLM
**So that** I maintain control over which images are shared with AI providers

**Context:**
Image analysis involves reading local files and sending them to external APIs. This requires explicit user approval for:
1. Privacy: User should know which images are being uploaded
2. Cost: Vision API calls may be more expensive than text
3. Security: Prevent accidental leakage of sensitive screenshots

The approval flow should show:
- Which images are being analyzed (file paths)
- Their sizes
- The destination provider
- Privacy implications

**Technical Notes:**
- src/consoul/tui/screens/approval.py - Approval modal screen
- src/consoul/ai/tools/approval.py - ToolApprovalRequest structure
- Risk Level: CAUTION (requires once-per-session approval)
- Show image file paths, sizes, and total count
- Warn about privacy: "Images will be sent to {provider}"
- Option to "Always allow image analysis" (session-only)
- Integrate with existing approval provider pattern

**Acceptance Criteria:**

**Given** I trigger image analysis for the first time in a session
**When** analyze_images tool is called
**Then** approval modal appears with image details

**Given** approval modal shows 2 images (screenshot.png 1.2MB, diagram.png 800KB)
**When** I review the request
**Then** I see clear file paths, sizes, and privacy warning

**Given** I approve the image analysis request
**When** I click "Approve"
**Then** images are sent to LLM and modal closes

**Given** I deny the image analysis request
**When** I click "Deny"
**Then** tool execution is cancelled with user-friendly message

**Given** I check "Always allow image analysis"
**When** I approve
**Then** subsequent image analysis in the same session doesn't require approval

**Testing Considerations:**
- Test approval modal rendering
- Test file path/size display
- Test session-level approval caching
- Test denial flow (graceful error)
- Mock TUI interaction for approval tests
- Verify privacy warnings are clear

**Implementation Hints:**
```python
# In approval.py
@dataclass
class ImageAnalysisApprovalRequest(ToolApprovalRequest):
    image_paths: list[str]
    image_sizes: list[int]  # bytes
    provider: str
    
    def get_summary(self) -> str:
        total_size_mb = sum(self.image_sizes) / (1024 * 1024)
        return (
            f"Analyze {len(self.image_paths)} image(s) using {self.provider}\n"
            f"Total size: {total_size_mb:.1f} MB\n\n"
            f"Files:\n" + 
            "\n".join(
                f"  • {Path(p).name} ({s/1024:.0f} KB)"
                for p, s in zip(self.image_paths, self.image_sizes)
            ) +
            f"\n\n⚠️  Images will be sent to {self.provider} API"
        )

# In TUI approval screen
class ImageAnalysisApprovalModal(ModalScreen):
    def compose(self) -> ComposeResult:
        yield Static(self.request.get_summary())
        yield Horizontal(
            Button("Approve", variant="success", id="approve"),
            Button("Deny", variant="error", id="deny"),
        )
        yield Checkbox("Always allow image analysis (this session)")
```

Files to modify:
- src/consoul/ai/tools/approval.py
- src/consoul/tui/screens/approval.py
- tests/ai/tools/test_approval.py
- tests/tui/test_approval_modal.py

Dependencies: SOUL-115 (tool registry integration)

comments.author: jared@goatbytes.io
comments.content:
Implementation approach changed during development. Instead of using analyze_images tool with approval UI, we implemented direct multimodal message creation (SOUL-116) which sends images directly to vision-capable models without tool intermediaries.

Current implementation:
- Images detected in messages (auto or via attachment button)
- Converted to multimodal HumanMessage with base64 encoding
- Sent directly to LLM without approval modal
- analyze_images tool disabled to prevent conflicts (commit c0aff84)

The approval UI described in this ticket is not needed with the current architecture. Image handling is transparent and immediate, similar to how ChatGPT/Claude web UIs work.

Marking as done - original intent (image support in TUI) achieved via different implementation path.
